intro: Vernonia pentaconta, commonly known as the five-and-fifty vernonia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Vernonia pentaconta is often found in open woodlands and prairies, thriving in well-drained soils. Its common name refers to the number of ray flowers typically present in its inflorescence.
